section.title: Introduction to Annuities-Due
section.p: In the last several sections, we met annuities immediate -- sequences of payments where the payments occur at the end of each period. In this activity, we will meet annuities due - annuities where the payments occur at the beginning of each period. There are also perpetuities due which is analogous.

What follows are problems, some of which are former exam problems. As with annuities immediate, we are only going to analyze the problems -- over the next few sections, we will build the machinery to solve them.

introduction.p: Chuck needs to purchase an item in 10 years. The item costs 200 today, but its price inflates 4% per year. To finance the purchase, Chuck deposits 20 into an account at the beginning of each year for 6 years. He deposits an additional X at the beginning of years 4, 5, and 6 to meet his goal. The effective annual interest rate is 10%. Calculate X.

task.p: Identify all annuities-immediate, perpetuities-immediate, annuities-due, perpetuities-due, and lump sums in the problem.
Create a timeline for the problem.

introduction.p: Bob wants to purchase a perpetuity paying 1000 per year with the first payment due at the end of year 11. He can purchase it by either:

li.p: paying 900 per year at the end of each year for 10 years; or
paying K per year at the end of each year for the first 5 years and nothing for the next 5 years.

task.p: Identify all annuities-immediate, perpetuities-immediate, annuities-due, perpetuities-due, and lump sums in the problem.
Create a timeline for the problem.

introduction.p: A perpetuity-immediate pays X per year. Brian receives the first n payments, Colleen receives the next n payments, and a charity receives the remaining payments. The share of the present value of the original perpetuity that Brian will get is 40%, and the share the charity will get is K.

task.p: Identify all annuities-immediate, perpetuities-immediate, annuities-due, perpetuities-due, and lump sums in the problem.
Create a timeline for the problem.

introduction.p: Kathryn deposits 100 into an account at the beginning of each 4-year period for 40 years. The account credits interest at an annual effective interest rate of \iota. The accumulated amount in the account at the end of 40 years is X, which is 5 times the accumulated amount in the account at the end of 20 years. Calculate X.

task.p: Identify all annuities-immediate, perpetuities-immediate, annuities-due, perpetuities-due, and lump sums in the problem.
